question: A 22-year-old Air-force test pilot presents after flying a sortie. Eye examination shows?
exp: Ans. (a) Subconjunctival hemorrhage. The history of test pilot in air force leads to possibility of G force acting on the subconjunctival vessels leading to their rupture and subsequent hemorrhage.

question: In case of xeropthalmia secondary to Vitamin A deficiency, what does X2 indicate according to WHO:
exp: Ans. (c) Corneal xerosis. Ref: A. K. Khurana 6th ed. /468* Xeropthalmia: all the ocular manifestation of Vitamin A deficiency.* First clinical sign of Vitamin A deficiency: Conjunctival Xerosis* First clinical symptom of vitamin A deficiency: Night blindness. WHO Classification of Xeropthalmia. CLASSSIGNSX1. AConjunctival xerosis. X1. BConjunctival xerosis with bitot's spot. X2. Corneal xerosis. X3. ACorneal xerosis with ulceration. X3. BKeratomalacia
